column3: et jūstitiam tuam fīliō rēgis; ^ Give to the king thy judgment
column5: and to the king's son thy justice;

column2: et pauperēs tuōs in jūdiciō. ^ to judge thy people with justice
et collēs jūstitiam. ^ Let the mountains receive peace for the people

column3: et humiliābit calumniātōrem. ^ He shall judge the poor of the people
column4: and he shall save the children of the poor
column5: and he shall humble the oppressor.

column3: in generātiōne et generātiōnem. ^ And he shall continue with the sun

column2: et sīcut stillicidia stillantia super terram. ^ He shall come down like rain upon the fleece
column3: and as showers falling gently upon the earth.
dōnec auferātur lūna. ^ In his days shall justice spring up
column5: till the moon be taken away.

column1: 9 ^ Et dominābitur ā marī usque ad mare
column2: et ā flūmine usque ad terminōs orbis terrārum. ^ And he shall rule from sea to sea
column3: and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

column2: et inimīcī ejus terram lingent. ^ Before him the Ethiopians shall fall down
column3: and his enemies shall lick the ground.

column1: 11 ^ Rēgēs Tharsis et insulae mūnera offerent; rēgēs Arabum et Saba dōna addūcent. ^ The kings of Tharsis and the islands shall offer presents; the kings of the Arabians and of Saba shall bring gifts.
12 ^ Et adōrābunt eum omnēs rēgēs terrae; omnēs gentēs servient eī. ^ And all kings of the earth shall adore him; all nations shall serve him.

column2: et pauperem cui nōn erat adjūtor. ^ For he shall deliver the poor from the mighty
column3: and the needy that had no helper.

column2: et animās pauperum salvās faciet. ^ He shall spare the poor and needy
column3: and he shall save the souls of the poor.

column1: 15 ^ Ex ūsūrīs et inīquitāte redimet animās eōrum
column2: et honōrābile nōmen eōrum cōram illō. ^ He shall redeem their souls from usuries and iniquity
column3: and their names shall be honourable in his sight.

column2: et dabitur eī dē aurō Arabiae
column3: et adōrābunt dē ipsō semper; tōtā diē benedīcent eī. ^ And he shall live
column4: and to him shall be given of the gold of Arabia
column5: for him they shall always adore; they shall bless him all the day.

column1: 17 ^ Et erit firmāmentum in terrā in summīs montium; superextollētur super Libanum fructus ejus
column2: et flōrēbunt dē cīvitāte sīcut foenum terrae. ^ And there shall be a firmament on the earth on the tops of mountains; above Lebanon shall the fruit thereof be exalted
column3: and they of the city shall flourish like the grass of the earth.

column1: 18 ^ Sit nōmen ejus benedictum in saecula; ante sōlem permanet nōmen ejus. Et benedīcentur in ipsō omnēs tribūs terrae; omnēs gentēs magnificābunt eum. ^ Let his name be blessed for evermore; his name continueth before the sun. And in him shall all the tribes of the earth be blessed; all nations shall magnify him.

column3: quī facit mīrābilia sōlus. ^ Blessed be the Lord

column1: 20 ^ Et benedictum nōmen majestātis ejus in aeternum
column2: et replēbitur majestāte ejus omnis terra. Fīat
column3: fīat. ^ And blessed be the name of his majesty for ever
column4: and the whole earth shall be filled with his majesty. So be it. So be it.
